DOC.brief_summary: Minimally invasive surgery ( MIS ) represent one innovative surgical treatment Hallux Valgus ( HV ) . However , long-term outcome still remain matter discussion within orthopaedic community . The purpose longitudinal prospective study evaluate radiographic functional outcome patient mild-to-severe HV underwent Reverdin-Isham Akin percutaneous osteotomy , follow exostosectomy lateral release .
DOC.brief_title: Functional Radiographic Outcomes Hallux Valgus Correction Mini-invasive Surgery With Reverdin-Isham Percutaneous Osteotomy
DOC.detailed_description: Eighty patient mild-to-severe symptomatic HV treat MIS . Clinical evaluation assess pre-operatively , well 3 12 month surgery final follow-up 48 month , use American Orthopaedic Foot Ankle Society ( AOFAS ) Hallux grade system . Patient satisfaction complication record . Computer-assisted measurement antero-posterior radiograph take pre-operatively , well 3 12 month surgery 48-month follow-up , analyse intermetatarsal angle ( IMA ) , hallux valgus angle ( HVA ) , distal metatarsal articular angle ( DMAA ) , tibial sesamoid position . Also , bridge bone/callus formation evaluate different radiographic follow-up , articular surface congruency metatarsal index calculate preoperatively last follow-up . Patient satisfaction assess use Visual Analogue Score ( VAS ) . Statistical analysis carry use pair t-test . Statistical significance set p < 0.05 .
DOC.criteria: Patients mild severe symptomatic hallux valgus Exclusion criterion : congenital deformity foot hallux rigidus previous first ray trauma foot ankle surgery rheumatic , dismetabolic , neurologic , infective , psychiatric pathology .
